body_html: You'll get a snapshot, but assuming the main process will continue training, it will need to copy all pages that contain the model data (and python data structures), which in turn will end up being even less efficient than doing a clone on all tensors from the state dict.
body_text: You'll get a snapshot, but assuming the main process will continue training, it will need to copy all pages that contain the model data (and python data structures), which in turn will end up being even less efficient than doing a clone on all tensors from the state dict.
body: You'll get a snapshot, but assuming the main process will continue training, it will need to copy all pages that contain the model data (and python data structures), which in turn will end up being even less efficient than doing a clone on all tensors from the state dict.
